page.title: 12RECREATION
page.content: RECREATION. ALLERTHORPE COMMON. This incorporates a practice area for Horse Trials, Cross Country, and Three day Eventing. The ditchs have been widened in sections & strengthened with planks. There are raised grassy platforms & obstacles made with car tyres. The ground is soft ideal for horses. Groups of young people use the area for Orienteering (Cross Country racing on foot using map & compass.) Shooting,the local farmers share the rights, although they hold very few shoots. This seems to be a good arrangement it helps to control the farm pests, Carrion Crow for example. Walkers. Regularly the public footpaths are walked by members of the Ramblers Association, thereby ensuring the paths are not obstructed and are clearly signposted.
